meanings.definition: Vigilant or alert in observing something.
meanings.sent1: The watchful cat kept an eye on the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She was watchful of her surroundings in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The watchful squirrel noticed the sneaky raccoon trying to steal its nuts.
meanings.sent4: The watchful owl spotted the tiny movement in the bushes.
meanings.sent5: The watchful lifeguard scanned the pool for any signs of trouble.

meanings.definition: Careful to observe and take notice.
meanings.sent1: The watchful student listened attentively to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: He was watchful of the changes in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The watchful detective noticed the subtle clues that others missed.
meanings.sent4: Her watchful eyes caught the small details that others overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The watchful scientist recorded every step of the experiment meticulously.
